data.title: Great Community Theatre
data.text: You can usually see many dramas and musicals in an intimate venue.  Many productions have a LBQT themes.  NCTC also has a youth theatre wing that helps young aspiring actors develop their skills

data.title: excellent production of Birds of a Feather, by Marc Acito
data.text:
We found several choices of theater in SF and decided to try Birds of a Feather (in preview), for its less traditional themes.  It was very well performed, with serious tones and light humor as well.  Birds of a Feather is about a gay penguin couple and gay marriage. The Paula Zahn digression was a bit weak, but on balance a good story and entertaining evening.

It opens this weekend (late May) and runs for several weeks.  Don't miss it if you are nearby!

And, the lineup for the New Conservatory Theatre Center looks good, whatever the season.  I'd always check it out for a SF visit.

data.title: Very welcoming small theatre
data.text: I believe this is a non-profit theatre which puts any money made into training underprivileged children in drama. It is a small theatre and has a very similar name to another larger theatre in SF. We went to see Xanadu there on a visit to SF. It was great and funny. We still talk about it today (a couple of months later!). I wanted to write coz I love the fact that actors are able to support less fortunate youth to learn a new skill.
